channel.title: Adding items into my client
channel.description:
how do i do it? i logged in on my client last night after doing the backround and stuff.
and it wasnt compatible with silab items they wer all gnome heads the silab items was.. how do i add silab items? please help

item.title: Adding items into my client
item.dc:creator: @mr_dharok mr dharok
item.description:
@mr_dharok wrote:

i cache extractor isnt 100% needed, benkskis model viewer includes most models i beleive, and in class8.java you need summat lookin a bit like this

if(i == 2781) // change this if you need to "item number" { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield";//New option class8.anInt174 = 7267; //Model ID class8.anInt181 = 1300; //zoom increase will make it smaller class8.anInt190 = 83; //model rotate up+down increase to move doen away from you class8.anInt198 = 2047; //model rotate side ways increase to move right in circle class8.anInt169 = 3; // model offset increase to move to the right class8.anInt194 = -1; //model offset increase to move up class8.anInt165 = 7254;//male wearing class8.anInt204 = 0; class8.anInt200 = 7262;//female wearing class8.anInt175 = 56;//Unknown class8.anInt197 = 116;//Unknown class8.anInt164 = -1;//Female arms/sleeves class8.anInt188 = -1;//male arms/sleeves class8.aBoolean176 = false;//Stackable class8.aString170 = "Runner hat";//Name of the new item class8.aByteArray178 = "A Penance Runner hat.".getBytes();//examin info }

you then go into the model viewer, find all the corresponding models (pickup, wield, inven), gzip add into your clients models folder log into your client on any server and type

add model (model id)

Read full topic

item.title: Adding items into my client
item.dc:creator: @shane1992 shane1992
item.description:
@shane1992 wrote:

i need this aswell lolz…
there is a tut on how to do it but it says you need:
a cache extracter and a model viewer
o yeh 1 prob… the links are dead and i cant find them…
so if any1 knows were to get them please help!?

Read full topic
